result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mike A Johnson was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock Device (IID) to be installed on all vehicles registered under Defendant's name.  IID shall be installed prior to Defendant obtaining a valid driver's license or occupational license. However, the length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued. (Call Department of Motor Vehicles with questions).

miscConds.notes: $1,718.00 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up a payment plan.
Must complete an AODA assessment &d comply with recommendations.

Huber/homemaker or Electronic Monitoring release at the discretion of the Jail.
159 days sentence credit if revoked.

CASES: 13CF361 and 14CF312. Defendant Mike A Johnson in court with attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   RL-clerk 2:23 pm. CT- recv'd Affidavit of MJohnson. Atty Anderson addresses ct re older files 02CT35 and 07CF253- prior convictions issue. CT reviews files.  Atty Sortedahl addresses ct. Atty Anderson addresses ct. CT addresses parties. CT finds affidavit raises issue. Atty Sortedahl calls MJohnson S&T 2:56 pm. ADA requests short break. Off record 2:57 pm. Back on 3:11 pm.  Atty Sortedahl questions witness. Exh 1- O&R. Exhs 2 and 3- O&R. Atty Anderson questions witness 3:59 pm. CT questions witness 4:15 pm.  4:26 JP-Clerk. Atty Anderson Argument.  4:50 adj. 

Ct - finds that Mr Johnson FVI&K entered plea and denies colateral attacks on that charge in Washington Cty MN.  

Ct - finds defendant was not fully advised of counsel in 02CT35 and grants defense motion for colateral attack and exclude conviction in this matter.

07CF253 challenge is withdrawn by Atty Anderson.

PSI - agent to do addendum to recommendation due to collateral attack.  Now OWI 6th not 7th - how does this change recommendation.
Sentencing hearing on October 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
